conversation.content: Um, yeah so I'm just—hmm, I guess I'm not getting my, uh, my codes? The two-factor thing?
Got it got it. So let me pull up your account here, what I need first is your email address and then I can check the authentication logs in system ACC-7294-B.
It's, um, let me think—no wait, actually it's, uh, jsmith at, um, techmail dot com.

Okay okay so, um, I'm seeing here that, uh, hmm, there've been seventeen attempts in the last, um, probably about two hours on account USR-88456-JX and, uh, none of them completed, so that's definitely, um, not right.
Seventeen? I tried maybe five times.
Right right so, um, what happens is, uh, the system sometimes, hmm, it sort of retries on its own when there's a, um, a delivery failure, you know? Let me check SMS gateway SGW-4419-Q here.
Just need to get in. That's all.
Um, so I'm seeing, uh, hmm, let me see here... okay so your number ending in 7749 is, um, is marked active but there's a, uh, carrier block code CBK-9902 showing up.
Carrier block? I've been—no wait, um, I've had this number for, uh, probably eight years? Maybe nine?

Yeah yeah absolutely, so what happens sometimes is carriers update their spam filters and legitimate codes get caught, happens with authentication messages all the time, I can override this with bypass protocol BYP-3847-MK.
Um, so that's—hmm, okay so that means what? I just, uh, wait? Or...?
No no, so I'm actually fixing it right now, just need about thirty seconds here to push override OVR-6623-PT through the gateway and reset your authentication preferences.
I've been a customer for, um, for six years? And I'm just—I mean, uh, this shouldn't happen, right?
Absolutely shouldn't happen. Got your override processed, now I'm generating a test code TCX-994502 to verify the pathway's clear.
Six years and I can't even, um, can't just log in? It's sort of, uh, ridiculous?
Test went through perfect. You should get codes instantly now, and I've added priority flag PRF-8826-VL to your account so this won't happen again.
Hmm, let me, uh, let me try it now then—no wait, um, should I wait? Or just...?
Try it right now while I'm here, that way if there's any issue I can fix it immediately with elevated access token TKN-55439-RD that I've got active.
Got it. Worked.
Perfect perfect, and just so you know I've documented everything under case number CSE-77812-QM with a full credit for today's inconvenience, should post within twenty-four hours to your account.
